name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Jeremy Neil EMERT, Appellee

judges: Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Jeremy Neil EMERT, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Based upon our disposition in Commonwealth v. Williams, 557 Pa. 285, 733 A.2d 593 (1999), we affirm the Order of the Lehigh County Court of Common Pleas dated September 2, 1998, insofar as it is consistent with our disposition in Williams and we reverse its order insofar as it is inconsistent with the same. Furthermore, we remand the matter to the court of common pleas for disposition of any remaining issues.
Jurisdiction is relinquished.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: James B. Martin, Dist. Atty., Kelly B. Waldron, Deputy Dist. Atty., for Com.
Michael Brunnabend, Allentown, Robert Long, Chief Public Defender, Glenn M. Goodge, Asst. Public Defender, for Jeremy Neil Emert.
casebody.head_matter:
734 A.2d 1288
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Jeremy Neil EMERT, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Aug. 3, 1999.
Decided Sept. 9, 1999.
James B. Martin, Dist. Atty., Kelly B. Waldron, Deputy Dist. Atty., for Com.
Michael Brunnabend, Allentown, Robert Long, Chief Public Defender, Glenn M. Goodge, Asst. Public Defender, for Jeremy Neil Emert.
Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
